vague_description: The hobbyist must determine the best combination of model trains and planes to produce within the constraints of available materials to achieve maximum profit.
detailed_description: A hobbyist makes model trains and planes using wood and paint. A model train requires \var{WoodTrain} units of wood and \var{PaintTrain} units of paint. A model plane requires \var{WoodPlane} units of wood and \var{PaintPlane} units of paint. The hobbyist has available \var{TotalWood} units of wood and \var{TotalPaint} units of paint. If the profit per model train is $\var{ProfitTrain} and the profit per model plane is $\var{ProfitPlane}, how many of each should be made to maximize his profit?
target_objective: The hobbyist wants to maximize his profit
target_constraints: Number of model trains is an integer
Number of model planes is an integer
Number of model trains is non-negative
Number of model planes is non-negative
The hobbyist can use at most TotalWood units of wood
The hobbyist can use at most TotalPaint units of paint
Each model train uses WoodTrain units of wood
Each model plane uses WoodPlane units of wood
Each model train uses PaintTrain units of paint
Each model plane uses PaintPlane units of paint
target_parameters: Units of wood required to make a model train
Units of paint required to make a model train
Units of wood required to make a model plane
Units of paint required to make a model plane
